title.rendered: Get The Required Treatment for Night Blindness At Eye Hospital In West Delhi

content.rendered:
Night Blindness is a kind of vision impairment that is also known as nyctalopia. People with this defect experience poor eyesight at night or dark environments. In some cases the disease is treatable and in some cases, it cannot be treated. Whatever the case maybe it is best to see the doctor and determine the underlying cause of it. You can get your eyes checked at an eye hospital in West Delhi. Night blindness can be caused due to a number of reasons and though the term suggests that it means being blind at night but this is not completely true. A person with night blindness may experience hazy or blurry vision at night or in dark. However, in some cases, it is almost impossible to see in the darkness. Here’s everything you need to know about night blindness.

What is the cause behind night blindness?

There are several conditions that can cause night blindness. Some of the major reasons are nearsightedness or myopia, cataract, retinitis pigmentosa, usher syndrome. Myopia is a condition in which the person can see nearby objects clearly but distant objects appear blurry. A cataract is a common disease and it is the clouding of the eye’s lens. Retina pigmentosa occurs when dark pigments collect in your retina and create a tunnel vision. Usher syndrome is a genetic disease that causes hearing and seeing defects. You can also suffer from Night blindness due to malnutrition or due to the deficiency of Vitamin A., It can also exist from birth or happen due to any injury.

What are the symptoms of night blindness?

There are several symptoms that can point out the fact that you have night blindness. The different kind of symptoms is: unable to see or have a problem to see in dark light or night time, headache, eye pain, nausea, vomiting, light sensitivity, cloudy vision, myopia.

What is the average age in which night blindness is likely to occur?

Night blindness commonly occurs between the age range of 40-60 years old. However, in some cases, the age might vary and it can also exist right from birth.

How to prevent night blindness?

You can prevent night blindness by eating a balanced diet and eating foods which are rich in vitamin A. It is important to keep your blood sugar level in control. Some common rules which you can follow are not sitting or staring too close to a screen, not reading in darkness or watching television for too long.

How To treat night blindness?

If doctors detect your night blindness at an early stage, then you can receive treatment and get a cure. Don’t ignore any of the symptoms above. Always seek treatment for your eyes at the best eye hospital in West Delhi – organ Hospital. They have the best doctors who provide advanced eye treatment at a really affordable price.
